docs.snippet: Two fiercely intense, always passionate, local rivalries with even more spice than usual take centre stage in the Premier League this weekend when Manchester United face Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur play Arsenal....

docs.snippet: Former NFL star Darren Sharper, who faces accusations in several states of drugging and raping women, has been indicted in Arizona on sexual assault charges, Tempe police said on Wednesday....

docs.snippet: After a drastic realignment and a season of change under Commissioner Val Ackerman, the conference headed into its tournament that begins Wednesday at Madison Square Garden....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a drastic realignment and a season of change under Commissioner Val Ackerman, the conference headed into its tournament that begins Wednesday at Madison Square Garden.
docs.abstract: Big East NCAA conference, following year of drastic realignment, is still being polished on the eve of the Big East tournament; commissioner Val Ackerman, who had to start from square one after departure of seven Catholic universities, has been setting up offices, lining up sponsors and spearheading new advertising campaign.

headline.main: The New Big East: In Spartan Offices, an Ornate Vision
headline.print_headline: The New Big East: in Spartan Offices, an Ornate Vision

docs.snippet: The men, who were in prison for nearly 18 years, said detectives had improperly conducted identifications, had coerced false statements from witnesses and had hidden evidence....
docs.lead_paragraph: The men, who were in prison for nearly 18 years, said detectives had improperly conducted identifications, had coerced false statements from witnesses and had hidden evidence.
docs.abstract: Carlos Perez, Michael Cosme and Devon Ayers, Bronx men who were set free in 2013 after spending nearly 18 years in prison for 1995 murders of Denise Raymond and Baithe Diop, murders they say they did not commit, are suing New York City and the two lead police detectives on the case.

headline.main: Set Free in 1995 Killings, 3 Bronx Men File Suits Alleging Police Misconduct
headline.print_headline: Set Free in 1995 Killings, Three More File Lawsuits Alleging Police Misconduct
